title: Dairy Microbiology
description: Microorganisms involved in the fermentation and ripening processes in the dairy industry, as well as those involved in spoilage of milk and dairy products, in the transmission of disease through these products, and indicator systems used to determine sanitary quality of these products. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory.
prerequisites: DSCI 233, and MCRO 221 or MCRO 224, and STAT 130 or STAT 218, or consent of instructor
